title: Jason Marshall (rugby union)
text:
Jason Marshall (born 5 February 1985) is a Canadian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. His position is <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%233.%20Tighthead%20prop">tighthead prop</a>, and he has played 27 tests for the Canadian national team. Marshall currently plays for <a href="Stade%20Rochelais">La Rochelle</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Pro%20D2">Rugby Pro D2</a>. Marshall had previously played rugby in the <a href="Canadian%20Direct%20Insurance%20Premier%20League">British Columbia Premiership</a> with <a href="Capilano%20RFC">Capilano RFC</a> and <a href="James%20Bay%20Athletic%20Association">James Bay Athletic Association</a>, <a href="British%20Columbia%20Bears">BC Bears</a> in the <a href="Canadian%20Rugby%20Championship">Canadian Rugby Championship</a>, and <a href="Stade%20Aurillacois%20Cantal%20Auvergne">Stade Aurillacois Cantal Auvergne</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Pro%20D2">Rugby Pro D2</a>.
Marshall originally had aspirations of becoming a professional football player as he played as a quarterback with <a href="Simon%20Fraser%20University">Simon Fraser University</a> and eventually tried out for the <a href="Edmonton%20Eskimos">Edmonton Eskimos</a> of the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a>. After being cut from the Eskimos Marshall focused on rugby eventually making the Canadian national senior team in 2008.
Marshall competed for Canada at the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a> starting at tighthead prop in all four of Canada's pool matches.
